KitKat::

She looked at Hydras. So far, he had ignored her and her suggestions. 
She was beginning to feel greatly unneeded here. She went about the 
base locking down the airvents and putting up the bionets on the 
outside of the shields to help slow down the plague if it came to the 
base.  She grumbled under her breath while she reformatted the air 
regulators so they would not allow outside air inside the base but 
recirculate the air through the main CircumFilters.  "Why would such 
a leader that I feel such great loyalty to just ignore someone who is 
trying to help him destroy our enemies?" under her breath.  Then an 
idea crept into her cybermind.  She smiled at the thought.  She could 
sneek out of this base, go to the maximal base. Surely she would 
encounter the plague. She would tell them she was seeking refuge from 
it and that she had not been infected. The maximals being so 
gullable, they would let her in and she would then infect the entire 
base of maximals with the plague. She grinned more evilly at this 
thought.  She would die, but then, the maximals would be wiped out 
and she would finally accomplish her one life's goal, and wipe out 
the maximals. She wrote a note to Hydras outlining her plan.
